activesubstance.activesubstancename: ASCORBIC ACID, ERGOCALCIFEROL, FOLIC ACID, RETINOL, TOCOPHEROL, VITAMIN B NOS

summary.narrativeincludeclinical:
Case number PHEH2011US00466 is an initial spontaneous legal case received on 15 Apr 2011, from the consumer's attorney in the form of petition (CV11-03028) and follow up received on 05 Oct 2012, 22 Oct 2012, 23 Oct 2012, 07 Nov 2012, 20 Nov 2012, 21 Nov 2012, 28 Nov 2012, 29 Nov 2012, 04 Dec 2012, 05 Dec 2012 and 06 Dec 2012 from a physician in the form of plaintiff fact sheet (2:11-cv-01098-HGB-DEK) and medical records. This case refers to an adult female patient. The patient had relevant medical history of breast metastases to spine (1989), breast reconstruction (1999), bilateral mastectomy (1989), pleural effusion, pleural thickening and central disc herniation at L4-5 updated, ectopic pregnancies, hysterectomy and appendectomy. She was allergic to iodine. The patient's family history included heart attack (father). The patient's concomitant medications included 5-fluorouracil, Capecitabine, Cyclophosphamide, Anastrozole, Fulvestrant, Megestrol, Tamoxifen, Ranitidine, Multi vitamins (ascorbic acid, ergocalciferol, folic acid, retinol, tocopherol, vitamin b nos), Celexin (cefalexin), Lopid (gemfibrozil) and Oxycontin. The patient was also smoker and alcoholic. In 2004, the patient initiated Zometa (zoledronate) for cancer. As a result of being infused with Zometa, the attorney alleged that the consumer developed osteonecrosis of the jaw, pain, infection, disfigurement, physical injury, suffering, emotional distress, mental anguish and physical disability. On an unspecified date, the patient developed sinus infection, tooth decay, pain in spine, pieces of bone coming through the jaw and discomfort in bone. The patient received dental anaesthesia and underwent teeth removal and jaw removal on the right side. Record dated 13 Jan 2004 noted that the patient suffered from cervical spondylosis. Record dated 14 Jan 2004 noted that the patient complaint of colonic diverticulosis. Record dated 01 Sep 2004 stated that the patient diagnosed with secondary malignant neoplasm of bone and thoracic spondylosis. The medical record dated 02 Mar 2005 stated the physical examination of her nose revealed mucosal hyperemia. She also had asthmatic bronchitis. Record dated 13 Mar 2004 noted that the patient diagnosed with degenerative joint disease of the lumbar and thoracic spine. Record dated 15 Apr 2005 stated that the patient had hypercholesterolemia and underwent bilateral breast implants. Record dated 04 Aug 2005 stated that the patient had chronic constipation, mild dysphagia, mild dyspnea, occasional tachycardia, frequent nocturia and mild paresthesias. The CT scan report of 28 Nov 2005 stated there was sclerotic lesion involved in left side of L3 vertebral body extending to the pedicle and also there was sclerotic focus in right sacral ala. The record dated 07 Dec 2005 stated she had nontoxic uninodular goiter and multiple thyroid nodules. The medical record dated 16 Dec 2005 stated the patient had chest pain of unknown etiology, allergic rhinitis and she had episodes of tingling sensation in her upper chest and neck area which was resolved after taking aspirin (acetylsalicylic acid). Record dated 22 Dec 2005 noted mild atherosclerosis of RT common carotid artery (CCA) and internal carotid artery (ICA). Record dated 19 Jan 2007 noted that the patient had progression of osseous metastases. Record dated 07 Jan 2009 stated that the patient felt broken tooth. Record dated 08 Jan 2009 stated that the patient had palpitations, bronchitis and blood transfusion. Record dated 21 May 2009 noted that the patient had coronary artery disease. In 2010, the treatment with Zometa was stopped. In same year, the patient was diagnosed with anemia. Dental record dated 14 Sep 2010 stated that the patient suffered from osteomyelitis of the right mandible. Record dated 15 Sep 2010 noted metastatic breast cancer to pelvis. On same record dated also noted pancytopenia and received blood transfusion. Record dated 16 Sep 2010 stated that the patient suffered from facial swelling. Dental record dated 17 Sep 2010 noted the patient had exposed mandible bone, erythema and swelling of the right jaw and facial cellulitis. Record dated 22 Sep 2010 stated that the patient had right mandibular aggressive erosive bone lesion. In Oct 2010, the patient had fractured her rib. On 08 Oct 2010, the patient underwent debridement of necrotic right mandible. Record dated 11 Oct 2010 noted that the patient had progressive metastatic breast cancer. The record dated 27 Oct 2010 stated she was short of breath. In 2011, the patient received radiation for her neck and underwent jaw surgery. Record dated 26 May 2011 revealed that the patient suffered from mild kyphoscoliosis. Dental record 18 Jul 2011 noted that the patient underwent alveoloplasty with extractions and had loss of bone. Record dated 12 Oct 2011 stated that the patient had chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), respiratory distress acute, hypoxia, hypokalemia and interstitial lung disease. Record dated 17 Oct 2011 stated that the patient had seizures and brain metastases. On 04 Mar 2012, the patient died. The seriousness and causality of the events with respect to suspect drug Zometa was not provided by the physician. The final outcome of the other events was not reported.
Follow-up report received from the consumer's attorney on 05 Oct 2012 inclusive of medical records: Patient's date of birth was updated. Patient's current condition (breast metastases to spine), medical history (surgery for breast reconstruction, smoker and alcoholic) and family history (heart attack) were updated. Treatment duration of Zometa was updated. Events (sinus infection, tooth decay, pain in spine, pieces of bone coming through the jaw, discomfort in bone, anemia, fracture of rib and patient died) and procedure (teeth removal, dental anesthesia, jaw removal surgery on right side, radiation on spine, radiation on neck and surgery on Jaw) were updated.
Combined follow-up report received from the consumer's attorney on 22 Oct 2012 and 23 Oct 2012 inclusive of medical records: Patients medical histories (bilateral mastectomy, pleural effusion, pleural thickening and central disc herniation at L4-5), procedures (alveoloplasty with extractions, debridement of necrotic right mandible, bilateral breast implants) and events (osteomyelitis of the right mandible, loss of bone, cervical spondylosis, colonic diverticulosis, degenerative joint disease of the lumbar and thoracic spine, secondary malignant neoplasm of bone, thoracic spondylosis, hypercholesterolemia, progression of osseous metastases, broken tooth, coronary artery disease, facial swelling, exposed mandible bone, erythema and swelling of the right jaw, facial cellulitis, progressive metastatic breast cancer and mild kyphoscoliosis) updated.
Follow-up report received from the consumer's attorney on 07 Nov 2012 inclusive of medical records: Events (chronic constipation, mild dysphagia, mild dyspnea, occasional tachycardia, frequent nocturia and mild paresthesias) were updated.
Follow up received on 20 Nov 2012 from physician via consumer's attorney inclusive of medical records. The patient’s medical history (ectopic pregnancies and hysterectomy) and events (Multiple thyroid nodules and mild atherosclerosis of Rt common carotid artery (CCA) and internal carotid artery (ICA) were updated.
Combined follow-up received on 21 Nov 2012, 28 Nov 2012 and 29 Nov 2012 from consumer's attorney inclusive of medical records. Events updated: COPD, respiratory distress acute, hypoxia, hypokalemia, interstitial lung disease, seizures, brain metastases, right mandibular aggressive erosive bone lesion, palpitations and bronchitis. Medical history included appendectomy. Procedure: blood transfusion.
Follow up received on 04 Dec 2012 from physician via consumer's attorney inclusive of medical records. Procedure (blood transfusion) and Events (metastatic breast cancer to pelvis and pancytopenia) were updated.
Combined follow-up report received from the consumer's attorney on 05 Dec 2012 and 06 Dec 2012 inclusive of medical records: Allergy: Iodine, Events: mucosal hyperemia, asthmatic bronchitis, sclerotic lesion in left side of L3 vertebral body and in right sacral ala, nontoxic uninodular goiter, chest pain, episodes of tingling sensation in her upper chest and neck area and allergic rhinitis.
summary.sendercomment: MAC: Review of available data reported in this legal case does not allow for proper causality assessments. Treatment dates with Zometa are not reported. Some conditions found in the report may not have developed under treatment with the product. The patient's events may be attributable to the underlying malignancy.
